definitions.definition: to one side; out of the way

examples.text: **Stand aside** and let these people pass.
He **took me aside** *(= away from a group of people)* to give me some advice.
**Leaving aside** *(= not considering at this stage)* the cost of the scheme, let us examine its benefits.
All our protests were **brushed aside** *(= ignored)*.
We **set aside** some money for repairs.

definitions.definition: used to say that except for one thing, something is true

examples.text: Money worries aside, things are going well.

wordOrigin: Middle English (originally on side): from a, ‘to, towards’ and side.
